CATERPILLAR: The larva of a butterfly or moth; leafworm.
CROQUET: (games) A game played on a lawn, in which players use mallets to drive balls through hoops (wickets).
DORMOUSE: Any of several species of small, mostly European rodents of the family Gliridae; also called Myoxidae or Muscardinidae by some taxonomists.
HATTER: A person who makes, sells, or repairs hats.
RABBIT: A mammal of the family Leporidae, with long ears, long hind legs and a short, fluffy tail.
